page.title: 06Community School
page.content: In 1980 Felton Primary School became a First School. The spare classroom was then used as a community room. There is a Nursery class 4 half days, a Pre-school Playgroup, a Mother and Toddler group 1 morning a week and a Baby Clinic on alternate Wednesdays. The health visitor,doctor and nurse are at the baby clinic. The babies are weighed and get injections. The mothers can buy baby foods. In the Mother and Toddler group there are about 10 mothers and their children. They have coffee and talk and the children play. The Playgroup is run by a rota of 4 mothers and a leader. The children aged 2-4 years do painting baking and cutting out. It is like a nursery without a teacher. The Brownies, Cubs and Guides each meet once a week at the school.
